## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```
# load data into R
```{r}
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
library(readr)
qfish <- read_csv("qfish data.csv")
qfish
```

# renamed a title of a colunm without a space
```{r} 
qfish <- qfish %>% rename(`fish`=`Fishing Type`)
```

# graphed an initial estimate of the data 
```{r}
ggplot(data = qfish) + 
  geom_line (mapping = aes(x=Year, y=Tonnes, colour= fish))

```

# reloaded R with all the data together 
```{r}
qfishalldata <- read_csv("qfishalldata.csv")
```

# plotted the data into a line graph and added a title 
```{r}
ggplot(data = qfishalldata) + 
  geom_line (mapping = aes(x=Year, y=Tonnes, colour= Fishing_Method)) + 
  ggtitle("QLD Line Fishery")
 
```


### data rangling 

```{r}
fishdata <- read_csv("fishdata.csv",col_names=TRUE)
fishdata
```
```{r}

fishdata <- read_csv("fishdata.csv", na = c("N/A", ""))
fishdata
```

```{r}
fishdata <- head(fishdata, -2)
fishdata
```

```{r}
fishdata <- fishdata %>% rename(`Beam_Trawl`=`Bream`)
```


```{r}
fishdatalong <- fishdata %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols = -CalendarYear,
    names_to = "Fishing_Type", 
    values_to = "Tonnes"
  )
```

```{r}
fishdatalong <- fishdatalong %>% mutate(across(everything(), ~ replace_na(., 0)))

```


```{r}
ggplot(fishdatalong, aes(x = CalendarYear, y = Tonnes, color = Fishing_Type, group = Fishing_Type)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Line Plot of Variables over Time", x = "Time", y = "Value") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = fishdatalong) + 
  geom_line (mapping = aes(x=CalendarYear, y=Tonnes, colour= Fishing_Type)) + 
  ggtitle("QLD Line Fishery")
```
